name: Dialysis Access Center Of Cincinnati, Inc.

top_procedures.description: Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation

Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and insertion of stent in dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of central venous catheter for infusion, patient 5 years or older
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Removal of central venous catheter for infusion

Dialysis circuit, introduction of needle(s) and/or catheter(s), with diagnostic angiography of the dialysis circuit, including all direct puncture(s) and catheter placement(s), injection(s) of contrast, all necessary imaging from the arterial anastomosis a
Insertion of abdominal catheter through the skin using imaging guidance including radiological supervision and interpretation
Tying or banding of a passage between an artery and vein
Balloon dilation of first vein, accessed through the skin or by open procedure, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Ultrasound scan of blood flow in extremity on both sides of body for preoperative assessment of blood vessel for dialysis access
Relocation of arm vein with connection to arm artery, open procedure, any site as separate procedure

Vessel mapping of vessels for hemodialysis access (services for preoperative vessel mapping prior to creation of hemodialysis access using an autogenous hemodialysis conduit, including arterial inflow and venous outflow)
Ultrasound scan of blood flow in extremity on one side for preoperative assessment of blood vessel for dialysis access
Mechanical removal of obstructive material from central venous catheter
